channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can bringing back manufacturing help the heartland catch up with 'superstar' cities?
item.description: In recent decades, America has seen economic opportunities concentrated in superstar cities. Manufacturing boosters hope reshoring factories could hel...

item.title: The fate of the EV tax credits depends on the GOP's megabill
item.description: The House version of the tax bill would revoke credits for EVs starting at the end of this year. If the plan survives, it would dramatically shape aut...

item.title: A surprising trick to making hard choices: Try thinking less
item.description: The tactic may seem counterintuitive, but it can help you make tough decisions faster and with more confidence, says decision coach Nell Wulfhart.

item.title: Who is the Colorado attack suspect? And, Ukraine demands Russia return stolen kids
item.description: Mohammed Sabry Soliman, the man arrested for throwing Molotov cocktails at people in Colorado, is facing several charges. Here's what we know about hi...

item.title: Run For Their Lives, the group targeted in the Colorado attack, is figuring out how to continue its mission
item.description: Sunday's attack in Boulder targeted a group called Run for Their Lives, which raises awareness about the hostages held by Hamas in Gaza. Now, they're ...

item.title: Boulder suspect backed off his initial plan to kill all in a group he called ‘Zionist,’ police say
Ukraine says it hit Crimea bridge with underwater explosives
item.description: Kyiv's security service says it it used more than 1,000kg of TNT to mine the supports of Russia's Kerch Bridge.

item.title: Gluten-free is everywhere, but is it right for you?
item.description: From bread to beer, gluten shows up in everyday foods. Dr. Jon LaPook examines who should avoid it and what to know before going gluten-free.

item.title: Japanese baseball legend Shigeo Nagashima dies aged 89
item.description: Known as Mr Giants, Nagashima was one of Japan's most famous sports stars during the 1960s and 70s.

item.title: 'Struggling to be alive': Kenyan activist speaks of 'sexual torture' in Tanzania
item.description: Boniface Mwangi says he has decided to speak despite the "shame and guilt" of being "sexually tortured".

item.title: Jacinda Ardern reflects on leadership, motherhood, and new memoir, "A Different Kind of Power"
item.description: In her first live interview about her new memoir, former New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern discusses her journey from humble beginnings to glo...

item.title: New Madeleine McCann search under way in Portugal
item.description: Authorities say the new search will be across 21 plots and will continue until Friday.

item.title: Candace Parker shares life lessons in "The Can-Do Mindset"
item.description: From championship wins to personal growth, Candace Parker talks with Natalie Morales about how she built resilience and stayed true to herself on and ...

item.title: Climate change meets comedy in new video campaign with David Cross and Michael Oppenheimer
item.description: "Climate Science Translated" pairs comedian David Cross with climate expert Michael Oppenheimer to break down complex science with humor as the campai...

item.title: The rise of the ultrarich and what it means for America
item.description: In his new book, "The Haves and the Have-Yachts," journalist Evan Osnos examines the rise of the ultra-wealthy, their luxury lifestyles, and growing i...

item.title: Jeremy Bowen: Killings near Gaza aid centre will deepen criticism of Israel's new distribution system
item.description: Western diplomats are looking on with dismay at the killing of hungry Gazans near aid hubs, writes Jeremy Bowen.

item.title: What we know about the man charged in the attack in Boulder, Colorado
Oil and gas have boomed in New Mexico, but fumes from wells are affecting schoolkids
